Key Match Events: In the ninth inning of the deciding Game 3 of the Wild Card Series, Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run off Milwaukee Brewers closer Devin Williams to save the Mets' season and send New York to the Division Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso said Iglesias' simple yet consistent messaging'meant a lot. Really, a lot. It meant so much to me.'
Mets owner Steve Cohen said, 'Great players, they come through in the clutch, right?' Just an incredible moment for him, for the team.
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, 'Proud of him,' 'It's a dream come true for him and for all of us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jose Iglesias told Pete Alonso, 'Next inning, you're going to hit a home run.'
